intro: Rubus trominsularis, commonly known as the Tromsø raspberry. It is a species of bramble native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of northern Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, red berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in harsh, cold climates and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. The botanical features of Rubus trominsularis include its prickly stems, trifoliate leaves, and its ability to form dense thickets.
